{"step_by_step_thinking": "HELLP syndrome is a life-threatening pregnancy complication usually considered to be a variant of preeclampsia. HELLP stands for Hemolysis, Elevated Liver enzymes, and Low Platelet count. So, Hemolytic anemia (H), Raised liver enzyme (E), and Thrombocytopenia (LP) are all features of HELLP syndrome. Eosinophilia, however, is not a feature of HELLP syndrome.", "answer_choice": "B"}
